ARABIC: قُلْ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّى عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'I fear, were I to disobey my Lord, the punishment of a dreadful Day.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Say: "If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a grievous Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Say: 'Surely do I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the chastisement of an awesome Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), say, "Because of the torment of the Great Day, I am afraid to disobey my Lord".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Say, “If I disobey my Lord, I then fear the punishment of the Great Day (of Resurrection).”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the torment of a Mighty Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: Surely I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the chastisement of a grievous day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'Indeed I fear, if I should rebel against thy Lord, the chastisement of a dreadful day.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say: I fear, if I rebel against my Lord, the retribution of an Awful Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "I will never disobey my Lord, for I fear the punishment of a dreadful Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou: verily fear, if disobey my Lord, the torment of a Mighty Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘Indeed, should I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a tremendous day.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "I would, if I disobeyed my Lord, indeed have fear of the penalty of a Mighty Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say: "I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the torment of a Mighty Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say: 'Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a great Day'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “I fear, should I defy my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [6:15] Say: ‘Indeed I fear, if I should rebel against my Lord, by worshipping other than Him, the chastisement of a dreadful day’, namely, the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) Muhammad: (I fear) I know, (if I rebel against my Lord) and worship other than Him, I would be reverting back to your religion, (the retribution of an Awful Day) I would face then a tremendous torment on an Awful Day; it is also said that this means: I would be facing torment on an Awful Day.
